Case reference: 2014001590.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1990, Claude L'Heureux was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Claude had worked in bars in The Village district of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2024001138.CaseDesc: Michael Walker left his friend's home in Norland, Ontario, following a weekend party on November 5, 2023. He was thought to be returning to his father's home, which is located 15 minutes east of the small hamlet of Kinmount, Ontario. On November 6, 2023, Michael's father discovered Michael's vehicle parked in his driveway, open and without keys. Michael has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001485.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Mohamad Daher was seen for the last time as he left his residence, in the Anjou district in Montreal, Quebec, for a business meeting. His vehicle was found at Le Boulevard Shopping Centre in the Saint-Leonard neighbourhood. Mohamad has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2014005728.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2011, James Mayer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. James had last spoken with his mother on December 14.

Case reference: 2014001985.CaseDesc: Odette Richard was last seen on February 25, 1990 at approximately 6:30 p.m., when she went for a walk from her home in Laval, Quebec. Odette has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Other, Full, upper and lower dentures
Deformity: Right Foot, Bone bump, top of foot

Case reference: 2021050310.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of October 13, 2021, Cody Harper was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Cody has not been seen or heard from since this time.

Case reference: 2014005673.CaseDesc: Tanya Nepinak was last seen leaving her home in downtown Winnipeg, Manitoba on September 13, 2011 to go shopping and has not been seen or heard from since. Tanya has always been in contact with her family and this behaviour is out of character for her.

Tattoo: Left Hand, Letters "T A N Y A" on each finger

Case reference: 2014004908.CaseDesc: David Buckmire was last seen leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario, at approximately 12:00 p.m. on July 31, 2003.

Case reference: 2014001474.CaseDesc: Pamela was last seen at her apartment complex on Lloyd Street in the city of Greater Sudbury, Ontario, in December of 1978.  She had left her son with her neighbour, and never returned. Her family had been expecting her to visit over the Christmas holidays, but she never went. When the family began trying to find her, they found that she had been missing for some time. She had left all her identification and personal belongings behind.

Case reference: 2014005536.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of March 25, 1996, Renée Simard was seen for the last time as she left her family home in Matane, Quebec. Renée had indicated that she was going for a walk, and at approximately 2:30 p.m. she was seen near the wharf along the Matane River at the mouth of the St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2014004543.CaseDesc: Marguerite Cardwell was last seen in Calgary, AB on Sept. 10, 1973, when she told a friend that she was planning on travelling to either Edmonton or Vancouver. Her vehicle was found near Canmore, AB on Sept. 16, 1973. Her purse and other personal belongings were found inside the vehicle.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Ankle, 2 inch screw in ankle

Case reference: 2004005470.CaseDesc: Tamra Jewel Keepness disappeared from her home on Ottawa Street in Regina, Saskatchewan when she was just 5 years old. She went missing from her bedroom sometime overnight.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Pockets on the front

Case reference: 2014006384.CaseDesc: On January 7, 2014, at approximately 12:20 a.m., Yinghui Zhu was seen for the last time at her family’s restaurant in Toronto, Ontario. Yinghui was supposed to open the restaurant the next day but did not show up.

Coat: Black, Winter, Winter jacket; Brand: Lacoste

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2008006899.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1966, Mr. Wynacht and two of his friends went hunting North of Sudbury along hydro pole lines, 20 miles north of Gauthiers corners on hwy 69, Kitchener Township. As a snow storm picked up, the hunters got separated along the pole lines, and Mr. Wynacht vanished. On the morning of Saturday November 5, 1966, a police cruiser led the search of the area with 35 citizens and two aircrafts. The search was completed on November 15, 1966, with negative results and no clue as to his disappearance had been uncovered.

Shirt: Wool, Red, Black, Checkered heavy doe skin

Case reference: 2006010399.CaseDesc: William Halverson was last seen getting into a canoe at Bald Indian Bay in Lake of the Woods. He failed to arrive at his destination of Pine Portage Bay.

Case reference: 2020007777.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1972, at approximately 3:30 am, Dina Kriba was last seen near 843 Danforth Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 1993001330.CaseDesc: Darlene was last seen at home.

Case reference: 2006013499.CaseDesc: Vital Vachon was last seen on May 1, 1973 when he departed a bush camp in Lucas Township, near Timmins, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003860.CaseDesc: Carl Charles Raun was reported missing on July 28, 1975. Mr. Raun had a fused spine, causing him to wear a brace, as well as a scar from back surgery. There is a possibility that Mr. Raun disappeared as a result of foul play, however this has not been confirmed.

Case reference: 2014004550.CaseDesc: On November 18, 2004, David Creaser was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta.

Tattoo: Shoulders, TIGER ON ONE SIDE, DRAGON ON THE OTHER

Case reference: 2014001333.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, members of the Canadian Armed Forces located the personal belongings of William Bereziuk washed up on an island in the Athabasca River 50 km north of Fort McMurray, Alberta. Mr. Bereziuk left Edmonton, Alberta in October of 1974 with the intention of making a canoe trip down the Athabasca River. He informed family members that he intended to spend the winter of 1974 in the Birch Mountain area of Alberta and would return to Edmonton in August of 1975. Mr. Bereziuk has never been heard from since.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Crucifix or scapular

Case reference: 2006005599.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1980, Foster Bezanson departed the Abitibi Road 48 area near Cochrane, Ontario to go hunting.  Mr. Bezanson failed to return and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000037.CaseDesc: On November 29, 2001, Henry Murillo Asprilla was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. On that day, he had a meeting with lawyers, which he attended with his ex-wife. After the meeting he drove his ex-wife home. Henry has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004031.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1974, Earland Christopher Feldseth was seen for the last time at a grocery store in Tofino, British Columbia. On April 11, 1974, Earland had set sail on a fishing trip on his 39-foot Fishing Trawler from Steveston Fisherman's Wharf in Richmond, British Columbia, with his 1969 Triumph motorcycle secured to the stern. Earland has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2009005399.CaseDesc: Brian Henry was last seen in North Bay, Ontario on May 5, 1974, at approximately 3:00pm. On that day, his father drove him to Canadore College, so he could walk the nature trails.

Hat: Black, Cowboy or scout type hat
Jacket: May have been wearing a green work jacket
May have been wearing a dark blue work jacket
Denim, Blue, "Coca Cola" logo on left pocket
Watch: Black, With a large black strap, glowed in the dark

Case reference: 2014006991.CaseDesc: Maxime Perreault was living alone and in an isolated area in the municipality of East Bolton and was working in the municipality of Eastman, in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec. On April 28, 2014, Maxime contacted his family and friends stating that he would visit them around May 3, 2014 in Beloeil, Quebec. He never arrived. He usually travels on foot, by bike, by bus or hitchhiking with a navy blue backpack.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2018016431.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, Crystal Hackett was seen for the last time in Lloydminster, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Crystal may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Jaw, Thin white scar on the right side of jaw

Case reference: 2014003314.CaseDesc: Dorothy Spence was last seen panhandling near a bridge in downtown Vancouver by a family member on or about August 17, 1995. Ms. Spence was of no fixed address and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Foul play has not been ruled out in Ms. Spence's disappearance.

Case reference: 2023043268.CaseDesc: Cavan Usher was last seen on the morning of June 22,2023 in the vicinity of Charlton Avenue East and James Street South, in Hamilton, Ontario. Despite Cavan leading a transient lifestyle, this is the longest period of time without any contact, either through social media or other means.

Case reference: 2006009599.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Ann Kant has been missing since October 16, 1972. She had been with a hunting party in Adair Township, approximately 73 miles east of Cochrane and was last seen about 2.4 miles south of Camp # 23, Abitibi limits.

Jacket: Black, Red, men's plaid hunting jacket
Jewelry: Gold, White, Yellow, ring; wedding band
Pants: Green, Ski slacks with elastic strap under the feet
Scar: Right Foot, from bone spur surgery

Case reference: 2014002176.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 30, 1997, Michelle McGillion was seen for the last time in Fort McMurray, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Michelle was living a high-risk lifestyle and may have been despondent. She has ties to Alberta, Yukon, and Ontario where her family resides.

Case reference: 2012003399.CaseDesc: Gregory Porter, 26, was last seen on October 5, 1984, when he was honourably discharged from the army at the Canadian Forces Base in Wainwright, Alberta. He had told people that he was going to British Columbia to drive a taxi. He was in good health both physically and mentally. The initial investigation revealed that Mr. Porter cashed a bank draft for $2400 on October 9, 1984, at a Royal Bank in Edmonton, Alberta. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005052.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2007, Ohanes Melkon was last seen when he departed his residence located in Innisfail, Alberta to go purchase food.

Case reference: 2012020661.CaseDesc: Darlene Anderson was last seen leaving the Hantleman Building at the Royal University Hospital in Saskatoon on November 6, 2006 at 8:00 pm.

Case reference: 2021054828.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2021, at approximately 6:30 p.m., Berhanei Peynado was seen for the last time in the area of Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Berhanei was despondent.

Coat: Black, WINTER, Winter coat with fur collar
Hat: Black, Gold, BASEBALL, Baseball hat with gold maple leaf
Shoes: Black, White, RUNNING, Brand: Air Jordan
Tattoo: Chest, Wolf, arc angel with sword

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2008007999.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, Charles Leslie Lewis and a friend were out fishing on Gull Rock Lake approximately 10km south of Red Lake. While they were out on the lake the winds picked up and began to create large waves, which caused the boat to capsize. Mr. Lewis and his friend clung to the bottom of the boat but were pushed off several times by the waves. Mr. Lewis was washed away from the boat. As he attempted to swim back to the boat, his head kept going under water.  At one point he did not resurface.

Jacket: Canvas, Brown, Orange, Hunting - ONG shoulder patches

Case reference: 2013000013.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1967, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Marianne Schuett was seen for the last time in the vicinity of the Kilbride Public School's driveway in North Burlington, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Marianne was seen talking to an unknown man in a vehicle, and it is believed that she was abducted by this man.

Hair: Brown, Bangs in front, ear length at back

Case reference: 2014003011.CaseDesc: In June 1980, William Dailey, an American citizen, left his home in New York State and traveled to Alaska with two friends. William was last seen in July 1980, in the Yukon on the return trip from Alaska. The men had been travelling in a 1972 Dodge dark blue flatbed pick-up truck with racks.

Case reference: 2012020179.CaseDesc: This adult Caucasian female was recovered from a freight yard north of 127 Water Street. in Vancouver.

Case reference: 2013000051.CaseDesc: Darren Fortier was last seen hitchhiking in Port Hardy on the evening of December 30, 1998.  Mr. Fortier had been involved in a serious injury a few years earlier which had left him with a metal plate and pins in his leg and a brain injury.

Hat: Cotton, Blue, Maroon, Colorado Avalanche Baseball Cap
Foreign Object: Left Thigh, Surgical Implant, Plate and 5 screws
Scar: Chin, Distinct on the left side of chin
Cheek, Down the right side of the face
Nose, Across the bridge of the nose

Case reference: 2013000088.CaseDesc: On February 19, 1973, Pierre Gariepy was seen for the last time in the Plateau-Mont-Royal district of Montreal, Quebec. Pierre is manic-depressive and was frequently hospitalized.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2014005066.CaseDesc: James Douglas Turnball or Turnbull was last seen on the MV Princess of Vancouver vessel commuting from Nanaimo to Vancouver in the waters of the Howe Sound in 1966. Bowen Island RCMP are seeking any next of kin or close relations for the missing male.

Jewelry: Gold, Yellow, Black, black diamond ring
Gold, Yellow, Brown, Timex watch with leather strap

Case reference: 2006022299.CaseDesc: Nick Kostiuk was last seen in a boat leaving a dock on Lower Manitou Lake. He could not swim and his wife saw him leaving without a life jacket. Mr. Kostiuk has been presumed drowned.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire frame
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Accutron watch

Case reference: 2019041758.CaseDesc: On July 2, 2019, Brany Rodriguez was last seen in Waterloo, Ontario.  He was known to lead a transient lifestyle and had previously stayed in all three cities in the Region of Waterloo. His whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2014004457.CaseDesc: Stephon Payne was last seen at his residence on October 6, 2002. On the same day, Stephon was seen in the area of 106 Avenue and 84 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. Stephon may have also been in the area of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton. A jacket believed to be Stephon’s was found at the bridge.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Heart with dagger

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003132.CaseDesc: On December 29, 1978, Sharon Drover was seen for the last time. Ms. Drover left her boarding house located in downtown St. John's, Newfoundland and arrived for her evening shift at McDonald’s restaurant. She finished her shift after midnight.

Case reference: 2014004447.CaseDesc: On October 13th, 2002, Yvonne King was reported missing from the community of Fox Harbour, Placentia Bay. Yvonne was last seen walking in the community.

Case reference: 2006007599.CaseDesc: Leland Iseler was last seen October 9, 1967, at a hunt camp on the Mattagami River,  near Cypress Falls, 30 miles north of Smooth Rock Falls.  His boat was found anchored about 100 feet off shore and his fishing rod was missing. Leland Iseler has never been located.

Case reference: 2008008099.CaseDesc: Ronald Wallin was canoeing in Upper Manitou Lake located south of Dryden.  Mr. Wallin suffered from what appeared to be a seizure and fell into the water disappering beneath the boat. The area was searched, but Mr. Wallin was not found.

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1995, Gareth Austin and Dominic Park were seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2008006798.CaseDesc: Jason Russell was last seen at the Casino in Niagara Falls. Mr. Russell was a student at Brock University in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2024015900.CaseDesc: Mary Clarke left her residence in Guelph, Ontario, on April 8, 1990.  Her vehicle was later found abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Coat: Wool, Blue, Tan, Knee length tweed trench coat.

Case reference: 2014005513.CaseDesc: Jayson Nakas was reported missing on June 30, 1995 to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Mr. Nakas fell off an inner tube on the North Saskatchewan River. Mr. Nakas' friends saw him go under water but did not see him come back up.  His friends were the last ones to see him that day.

Case reference: 2014006179.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, Burnaby RCMP were advised that Lon Batchelor had sent his brother a letter requesting he become his power of attorney and that he give his daughter a good-bye note (stating that Lon was "going for the long walk"). This is out of character for Lon. Anyone having seen Lon since July 1, 2013, or who may be able to provide any information as to his whereabouts, is asked to contact the police.

Case reference: 2006017799.CaseDesc: Véronique Courchesne was last seen at her residence November 11, 1979. She was depressed due to a recent medical diagnosis. She had withdrawn money from her bank account prior to going missing. On December 31, 1979 she contacted her husband by telephone but has not been heard from since.

Amputation: Right Chest, Mastectomy to the right breast

Case reference: 2017061282.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1999, Andrew Fraser was seen for the last time near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002293.CaseDesc: Gilles Hudon left the town of La Sarre, Quebec on August 20, 1980, in his aunt's car. On September 13, 1980, the car was found on a logging road near Camp 46 of the Abitibi Price logging camp in the Cochrane area of Ontario.

Case reference: 2020011480.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1988, Amerk Barbarian was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Amerk had been seen by his landlord for the last time when his rent was collected.

Case reference: 2014005030.CaseDesc: Wilfrid Langlois has been missing since February 5, 1998. At the time of his disappearance, it is possible that he was in the Chandler area of the Gaspé Peninsula.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2014002146.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1984, John Lake  was last seen leaving a hospital in Vancouver, British Columbia. He stated he was heading to Seattle.

Scar: Left Side Of Head, From ear to chin

Case reference: 2022036924.CaseDesc: Paul Bellemore was last seen on video in Cornwall, Ontario, on July 29,2022.

Hat: Grey, Hurley brand dark grey ball cap

Case reference: 2014005436.CaseDesc: On May 5, 2009, Mohamed Ibrahim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004687.CaseDesc: Gertrude Power is originally from the Maritimes and was last heard from by family members in the 1970s, when they suspected she was living in British Columbia, where she may have worked as a waitress on Vancouver Island.  She was known as "Trudy."

Hair: Blonde, Long, Dyed blonde or red hair and was known to wear wigs

Case reference: 2014004635.CaseDesc: In 1986, Sarah Skunk visited with family members located in Mishkeegogamang First Nation and Shabaqua, ON. Since that time, she has not been heard from by any family members. Family fears that she may be deceased. Sarah was known to frequent Vancouver BC, Sudbury ON, and Washington State, USA. Sarah spent some time on the streets. She was known by numerous aliases and may have had children.

Mark: Mouth, Wart on inside of mouth

Case reference: 2014005576.CaseDesc: Daniel Dumigan's family lost contact with him in July of 1975. They received information that he was planning to leave for Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2013000129.CaseDesc: Immaculate Basil was last seen June 14, 2013 on a road in a remote area north of Fort St James, BC.

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2014005612.CaseDesc: Carol Handy was last seen on March 16, 2011 in Edmonton, Alberta. Her family heard her leave her bedroom at approximately 2:30 am. She has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001381.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1982, Patricia Elizabeth Flynn was last seen running away from her family residence in a densely wooded area near her home in Yarrow, British-Colombia. Patricia was despondent and had medical issues that required attention at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014004591.CaseDesc: In July 2004, Philip Leishman left his residence with a friend from Kakisa Lake, Northwest Territories. Philip had told his family that he would be travelling to Fort McMurray, Alberta, and it was confirmed that he was in Fort McMurray until late August of 2004. Philip has ties to Port Alberni, British Columbia, Grand Prairie, Alberta, and Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2014005293.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 20, 1999, Abdol Hossein was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Scar: Cheek, Welts all over his face and cheek

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2018063238.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2001, Edward Pinarreto was seen for the last time when he left Toronto, Ontario, for a two-week vacation in Cuba. Edward was scheduled to return to Toronto on February 3, but never board his flight.

Case reference: 2019024246.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2019, Daniel Richards was seen for the last time in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario. Niagara Police responded to a report of a man that had jumped into the falls. The police were able to obtain a description and a photograph of the man who was identified as Daniel. His vehicle was located abandoned in the nearby area.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2014004569.CaseDesc: In August 1966, Philomene (Tiger) Lemay was socializing at a local bar in Slave Lake.  She was last seen very intoxicated.  Mrs. Lemay may have left with one or two men, possibly Americans, in the early evening.

Case reference: 2018041224.CaseDesc: Ashley Morin was last seen leaving a house in North Battleford, Saskatchewan on July 10, 2018. Ashley left the house on foot, and has not been in contact with family or friends since.

Case reference: 2014002692.CaseDesc: Between September 3 and October 3, 1978, Jean-Jacques Sirois was seen for the last time in the Rosemont District in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with rectangular cubic zirconia

Case reference: 2014001394.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 2002 Jeremy Crawford was seen for the last time at his residence in Crystal Beach, Ontario. His vehicle was located on Clifton Hill in Niagara Falls, Ontario on the same date. At the time of his disappearance, Jeremy was despondent.

Case reference: 2020008698.CaseDesc: On December 13, 1969, Helen Booth was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Helen had gone out with her boyfriend and he thought she was going to go home with a friend at 11:30pm.

Case reference: 2023013234.CaseDesc: Jake Corbiere was last seen by his roommate on March 12, 2023, in Sault. Ste. Marie, Ontario. He left his home with an unknown male, advising that he was going to the nearby Tim Hortons.  Jake is known to lead a high-risk lifestyle and it is believed that he may have been the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014004973.CaseDesc: Luke Retieff was last seen by his mother at his residence on July 21, 2007. He had been prescribed numerous medications for his medical conditions. He was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Wavy, Light brown goatee
Boots: Leather, Brown, hiking boots, shoe size 9 - 10
Coat: Nylon, Red, Ski jacket with black and white stripes on arms

Case reference: 2014006341.CaseDesc: Alma Mae Gillespie has been missing since June 10th, 1996 from her residence in Winnipeg, MB. Prior to her disappearance, she talked of wanting to go away and disappear for a while.  This has been done on numerous occasions before, even for years at a time.  In the past she has resurfaced within either the United States or Canada.

Case reference: 2018008230.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1993, Trevor Chase was seen for the last time by his relatives in Truro, Nova Scotia. Trevor’s family believed that he may have been residing in Vancouver, British Columbia, in 1994.

Case reference: 2020009327.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2020, James Garnett was seen for the last time at approximately 9:25 pm when he was exiting a bus onto Douglas Avenue near the Reversing Falls Bridge located in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Hat: Blue, White, Toque, Has white snowflakes

Case reference: 2008020099.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1997, James Arthur Hopcroft left the Cedar Haven Rest Home in East Gwillimbury, Ontario where he was a resident. Mr. Hopcroft has turned up on previous occasions at Queen Street Mental Health Centre. A check of the immediate surrounding area and hospitals failed to locate him. Mr. Hopcroft remains missing.

Case reference: 2006012699.CaseDesc: John James Semple lived in a retirement home on Yearly Road, Huntsville, Ontario.  He was last seen in Huntsville in January 1998.

Case reference: 2014002017.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1997, Marc Dionne was seen for the last time as he was leaving the Harley Pub in the Cap-de-la-Madeleine area of Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was a passenger in a small white vehicle. Marc was reported missing on the next day and there has been no news from him since.
